{"step_by_step_thinking": "The presence of a dentigerous cyst surrounding the crown of the tooth indicates that the tooth is impacted. The treatment of choice for an impacted tooth with a dentigerous cyst is usually surgical removal of the cyst and extraction of the impacted tooth. Aspiration of the cyst alone may not be sufficient to resolve the issue. Observation without intervention is not recommended as the cyst can continue to grow and cause further complications. Exposing the crown and keeping it exposed is not a common treatment option for a dentigerous cyst. Therefore, the answer choice is A. Extraction of the molar.", "answer_choice": "A"}
